item.title: 德国商业银行估值突破 300 亿欧元，裕信银行对其感兴趣
item.description: 德国商业银行（Commerzbank AG）的市值首次突破 300 亿欧元（330 亿美元），此前这家德国贷款机构的股价在盈利强劲和收购兴趣的推动下延续了多年来的涨势。【原文：Commerzbank AG’s market capitalization surpassed €30 billion ($33 billion) for the first time after the German lender’s stock extended a years-long rally, fueled by earnings strength and takeover interest.】

item.title: 被拘留的菲律宾前总统杜特尔特在市长竞选中遥遥领先
item.description: 菲律宾前总统罗德里戈-杜特尔特（Rodrigo Duterte）在其部族大本营菲律宾南部的地方选举中遥遥领先，尽管他因涉嫌反人类罪正在荷兰等待审判。【原文：Ex-Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte is leading in the local election in his clan’s stronghold south of the country, even as he awaits trial in the Netherlands for alleged crimes against humanity.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚债券销售吸引投资者，收益率飙升，卢比上涨
item.description: 罗马尼亚在一次国内债券销售中成功地吸引了稳固的需求，但由于第二轮总统选举前的政治风险继续影响投资者的看法，这笔资金的价格也随之提高。【原文：Romania managed to attract solid demand in a domestic bond sale but the funding came at an increased price as political risks before the presidential run-off continued to weigh on investors’ perception.】

item.title: 洛杉矶充电器公司与私募股权公司 Arctos 商谈出售股权事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，洛杉矶充电器队正在与 Arctos Partners 谈判出售 NFL 球队的股份。【原文：The Los Angeles Chargers are in talks with Arctos Partners to sell a stake in the NFL team, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根大通明星科技银行家南布里加盟通用催化剂公司
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Veteran JPMorgan Chase & Co. technology banker Madhu Namburi is leaving the Wall Street bank after 25 years to join a venture capital firm.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利称企业更青睐员工持股销售而非首次公开募股
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的研究显示，随着让员工套现部分持股的压力增大，有员工股东的私营公司更有可能在下一步进行要约收购，而不是首次公开募股。【原文：Private companies with employee stockholders are more likely to do tender offers next than IPOs as pressure mounts to let staff cash out some of their holdings, according to research from Morgan Stanley.】

item.title: 多莱坞业主启动 10 亿美元贷款，为主题公园交易提供资金
item.description: 多利伍德公园及度假村（Dollywood Parks & Resorts）的所有者周一推出了 11 亿美元的杠杆贷款，以帮助其为收购全美各地的游乐园、露营地和酒店提供资金。【原文：The owner of Dollywood Parks & Resorts on Monday launched a $1.1 billion leveraged loan to help fund its acquisition of a suite of amusement parks, campgrounds and hotels throughout the US.】

item.title: 经济衰退的声音越来越大。关注这些指标
item.description:
我们建立了一个仪表板，帮助您了解我们是否正在走向衰退。【原文：

We’ve built a dashboard to help you figure out if we’re headed for a downturn.

】

item.title: 中美贸易战缓和后，法国伦巴第希望更广泛地取消关税
item.description: 法国财政部长埃里克-隆巴对中美贸易战暂停90天表示欢迎，但他说，需要做出更多努力来缓和全球关税紧张局势。【原文：French Finance Minister Eric Lombard welcomed the 90-day hiatus in the US-China trade war, but said more efforts are needed to de-escalate global tariff tensions.】

item.title: S&P 预计 2025 年阿联酋将发行 180 亿美元本币债务
item.description: 全球评级公司 S&P 表示，作为构建国内债务收益曲线、偿还到期债务和部分弥补预算缺口努力的一部分，阿联酋联邦政府和各个酋长国预计将在今年发行总计 180 亿美元的本币贷款。【原文：The UAE federal government and individual emirates are expected to issue a combined $18 billion in local currency loans this year as part of efforts to build a domestic debt yield curve, repay maturing obligations and partly fund budget shortfalls, global ratings firm S&P said.】

item.title: 纽约市最高塔楼首次出租最高楼层
item.description: 世贸中心一号楼位于约 1100 英尺的高空，几乎是纽约市的最高点，它首次出租办公空间；这是曼哈顿下城长期复苏过程中的一个引人注目的里程碑。【原文：Some 1,100 feet in the air, almost as high as you can go anywhere in New York City, One World Trade Center is leasing office space for the first time — a striking milestone in Lower Manhattan’s long recovery.】

item.title: 市场对中美贸易停战的反应
item.description: 交易员在纽约证券交易所大厅工作。摄影师：迈克尔-纳格尔/布鲁姆伯格【原文：Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg】

item.title: 卡尼赢得大选后加拿大消费者信心上升
item.description: 由于全国大选的结束缓解了人们对国家走向和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁的焦虑，加拿大人对经济越来越乐观。【原文：Canadians are growing more optimistic about the economy, as the conclusion of a national election relieves some anxiety around the country’s direction and US President Donald Trump’s threats.】

item.title: 炼油厂消失，加州司机纷纷掏腰包
item.description:
州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）向金州石油公司发出的最新呼吁可能已经来不及阻止汽油产量的持续下降。【原文：

Governor Gavin Newsom’s latest outreach to the Golden State’s oil companies may be too late to arrest a steady decline in gasoline production. 

】

item.title: 自特朗普说 "买入的好时机 "以来，S&P 500 指数已跃升 14
item.description: 在过去一个月里，那些听从唐纳德-特朗普总统在社交媒体上的建议的投资者享受到了他领导下的 S&P 500 指数的最大涨幅之一。【原文：Investors who followed President Donald Trump’s advice on social media in the past month have enjoyed one of the biggest rallies in the S&P 500 under his leadership.】

item.title: 特朗普家族的比特币矿业公司将在 Gryphon 交易中上市
item.description: 作为与麒麟数字矿业公司（Gryphon Digital Mining）合并协议的一部分，一家与特朗普家族有关联的专注于比特币的企业将上市。【原文：A Bitcoin-focused venture tied to the Trump family is to go public as part of a merger agreement with Gryphon Digital Mining.】

item.title: 英国与欧盟在重启峰会前几天就鱼类和食品问题讨价还价
item.description: 就在伦敦峰会召开前一周，英国和欧盟仍在努力解决渔业和食品检查方面的分歧，英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）计划在峰会上宣布脱欧后关系的重大调整。【原文：Britain and the European Union are still trying to resolve disagreements over fisheries and food checks just a week before a summit in London where Prime Minister Keir Starmer plans to announce a major reset in post-Brexit relations.】

item.title: 中美两国从脱钩边缘后退
item.description: 我是驻香港的经济记者 Katia Dmitrieva。今天我们关注美国小企业和关税问题。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Katia Dmitrieva, an economics reporter in Hong Kong. Today we’re looking at US small businesses and tariffs. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 德国太阳能发电量再创新高
item.description: 德国数以千计的太阳能电池板在本周一创下了新的生产纪录。【原文：Germany’s many thousands of solar panels set a new production record on Monday.】

item.title: 匈牙利预算缺口达 80 亿美元后冻结部分开支
item.description: 由于利息支出超过了税收收入的增长速度，匈牙利政府的赤字在四月份创下了历史新高，这导致政府宣布冻结部分预算支出。【原文：Hungary’s government deficit rose to a record through April as interest payments outpaced tax income growth, leading the government to announce a spending freeze in parts of the budget.】

item.title: NRG Energy 将以 120 亿美元从 LS 收购天然气发电资产
item.description: NRG Energy Inc. 同意以约 120 亿美元（含债务）的价格从 LS Power Equity Advisors LLC 收购天然气发电资产。【原文：NRG Energy Inc. agreed to acquire natural gas-fired power assets from LS Power Equity Advisors LLC for about $12 billion including debt.】

item.title: 贝恩将斥资 7.56 亿美元收购日清股份以实现私有化
item.description: 日本物流公司日清公司（Nissin Corp.）称，贝恩资本（Bain Capital）将从股东手中购买其股份，通过管理层收购实现私有化，交易价值约为 1,120 亿日元（7.56 亿美元）。【原文：Japanese logistics company Nissin Corp. said Bain Capital will buy its shares from shareholders for it to go private through a management buyout, in a deal worth about ¥112 billion ($756 million).】

item.title: 裁决后的 iPhone 更好用，限制更少
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，奥斯汀-卡尔（Austin Carr）将探讨苹果公司（Apple）被判改革其应用程序商店（App Store）做法的最新裁决所带来的影响。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr looks at the impact of the latest ruling ordering Apple to reform its App Store practices.】

item.title: 企业称特朗普关税造成伤害的礼貌方式
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税大战中出现的一个引人注目的现象是，"礼貌轻视 "的艺术重生了。或者说，公司和行业游说者在公开声明和政府征求对即将到来的关税发表评论的要求中，发出了 "谢谢，但不谢，先生 "的暗语。潜入其中，忽略周围的现代环境，你可能会被原谅，以为自己在读历史书信，其中充满了仪式、礼节和大量的 "谢谢"。【原文：One of the remarkable things emerging from President Donald Trump’s tariff wars is a rebirth of the art of the polite slight. Or the “thanks but no thanks, sir” in the coded messages companies and industry lobbyists are putting out in public statements and submissions to government requests for comment about forthcoming tariffs. Dive into some and ignore your modern surroundings and you could be forgiven for thinking you are reading historical letters layered in ceremony, protocol and plenty of】

item.title: 报告称西班牙南部停电先于全国停电
item.description: 两周前，西班牙南部发生了全国性大停电，数百万人陷入黑暗之中。【原文：Power failures in southern Spain preceded a nationwide blackout that left millions in the dark two weeks ago, according to the most detailed report yet on the events leading up to the debacle.】

item.title: 中美会谈后，"购买美国 "席卷全球市场
item.description: 随着中美之间的暂时休战掀起了另一波股市反弹，美国股市目前的交易情况就像唐纳德-特朗普的 "解放日 "冲击从未发生过一样。【原文：With the temporary truce between the US and China kicking off another equity rally, American stocks are now trading like Donald Trump’s “Liberation Day” shock never happened.】

item.title: 电影观众减少，印度顶级连锁影院寄希望于宝莱坞的复苏
item.description: 印度顶级连锁影院 PVR Inox Ltd. 在经历了乏善可陈的一年后，正寄希望于一系列好莱坞和宝莱坞影片的上映来挽回观影者的热情。【原文：India’s top cinema chain PVR Inox Ltd. is betting on a slew of Hollywood and Bollywood releases to bring back movie-goers after a lackluster year.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称苹果考虑在新产品阵容中提高 IPhone 售价
item.description: 华尔街日报》援引知情人士的话称，苹果公司正在考虑提高今年晚些时候推出的 iPhone 系列的价格，并将避免把任何涨价归咎于关税。【原文：Apple Inc. is weighing raising prices for the iPhone lineup coming out later this year, and will avoid blaming any increases on tariffs, the Wall Street Journal said, citing people familiar with the matter who it didn’t name.】

item.title: 贸易战降温，投资者再爱风险
item.description:
美元上涨，债券下跌，全球股市上涨

。【原文：

The dollar is rising, bonds are falling and stocks are up around the globe

】

item.title: 软银与 OpenAI 的星际之门合资因关税担忧受阻
item.description: 软银集团（SoftBank Group Corp. ）在美国投资 1,000 亿美元建设人工智能基础设施的计划已经放缓，华盛顿关税带来的经济风险阻碍了融资谈判。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp.’s plans to invest $100 billion in artificial intelligence infrastructure in the US have slowed, with economic risks stemming from Washington’s tariffs holding up financing talks.】
